text.text: How are charge rates entered in the ZOLL Billing system?

text: Charge rates are entered on the Charges tab under Settings and departmentalized into groups called categories. To get to the Charges tab, click Settings on the navigation bar.

text.text: What are charge categories, and where can they be found in the system?

text: A category is a grouping of rates for a specific purpose. Charge categories can be found on the Charges tab under Settings.

text.text: Can you explain the purpose of the Universal category for charge rates?

text: The Universal category shows default company charges. These are the charges that display by default on the Charges tab when you are creating or working a claim.

text.text: How can I define or modify charge rates within the Universal category?

text:
To define or modify charge rates within the Universal category, follow these steps:
1. On the Charges tab under Settings, click the View field and select the Universal category.
2. Click Edit.
3. Add or change rates as needed.
4. Click Save.

text.text: What are the three main groupings of charges on the Charges page, and what do they cover?

text:
The three main groupings of charges on the Charges page are:
1. Base rates, which cover ALS, BLS air, specialty care, and wheelchair transport.
2. Mileage charges.
3. Supplies and additional services.

text.text: Why can't the names under the 'Charge description' field be modified or deleted?

text: The names under the 'Charge description' field cannot be modified or deleted because they are used by Medicare.

text.text: When might you create additional charge categories, and can you provide examples?

text: You can create additional charge categories when your charges differ from the Universal rates. For example, you can create a category for charges that are specific to a trip type, such as a Northwest category with rates that are unique to trips to that region. You can also use categories to create rates with a start and end date.

text.text: How does having multiple charge categories affect the display of rates on the Charges tab?

text: Without a category defined, the Charges page only displays your base rates. Once you create a category, your base rates will show under the Universal category.

text.text: What steps are involved in adding a new charge category?

text:
To add a new charge category, follow these steps:
1. Click Settings on the navigation bar.
2. Click the Charges tab.
3. Click Add a charge category.
4. Enter the name of the category.
5. If you want the charge rates to only apply for a specific time period, select the Effective date and Expiration date.
6. Click Continue.
7. Enter the rates in the "Price per unit" field.
8. Click Save.

text.text: Could you walk me through the process of deleting a charge category?

text:
To delete a charge category, follow these steps:
1. Click Settings on the navigation bar.
2. Click the Charges tab.
3. Click the View field and select the category you want to delete.
4. Click Edit.
5. Click Delete charge category.
6. Click Delete on the confirmation window.

text.text: Where can I find options to add or edit charge rates in the system?

text:
To add or edit charge rates, follow these steps:
1. Click Settings on the navigation bar.
2. Click the Charges tab.
3. Click the View field and select the charge category.
4. Click Edit.
5. Change rates as needed.
6. Click Save.

text.text: Can charge rates be customized based on specific time periods, and if so, how?

text:
Yes, charge rates can be customized based on specific time periods. To do this, follow these steps:
1. Click Settings on the navigation bar.
2. Click the Charges tab.
3. Click Add a charge category.
4. Enter the name of the category.
5. Select the Effective date and Expiration date for the time period you want the rates to apply.
6. Click Continue.
7. Enter the rates in the "Price per unit" field.
8. Click Save.

text.text: What is the significance of adding a date range to a charge category?

text: Adding a date range to a charge category allows you to specify when the rates in that category will take effect and when they will expire. This is useful if you need to have different rates for different time periods.

text.text: How do I navigate to the page for adding or editing charge rates?

text:
To navigate to the page for adding or editing charge rates, follow these steps:
1. Click Settings on the navigation bar.
2. Click the Charges tab.

text.text: How to add new charge category?

text:
To add a new charge category, follow these steps:
1. Click Settings on the navigation bar.
2. Click the Charges tab.
3. Click Add a charge category.
4. Enter the name of the category.
5. Click Continue.
6. Enter the rates in the "Price per unit" field.
7. Click Save.

5. Click Delete charge category.
6. Click Delete on the confirmation window.

text.text: how many categories can i have?

text: You can have as many categories as you need.
Sorry, what was that?

text.text: give me examples for category

text:
Category examples:
• Charges that differ: Create a new category that contains the applicable charges. You can apply these charge rates to the claim by selecting that category on the Claim page.
• Charge increases: Create a category with an effective date on which the new increase will take effect.
• Temporary charge changes: Create a category with the new charge and enter a termination date in the expiration date field. After the expiration date, the system reverts the charge rate back to the Universal charge rate.

text.text: Working with charge categories

text: A category is a grouping of rates for a specific purpose. Default company charges are shown in the Universal category. For charges that differ from the Universal rates, create a new category. You can also use categories to create rates with a start and end date.
For more information click this: https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=xz4vz0ura6
